alert.note: Alert for Central Coast Range of Western Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 11 at 12:01PM PDT until April 11 at 2:00PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow expected above 1500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches likely, snow accumulations up to 6 inches possible in the highest terrain. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Central Coast Range of Western Oregon. * WHEN...Until 2 PM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Many roadways will remain snow or slush covered through midday. Power outages are also likely due to the weight of snow bringing down trees and powerlines.
info.instruction: Slow down and use extra caution while driving, and allow extra time to reach your destination. Be alert for downed trees and powerlines on roadways, and use caution when switching lanes if slush has built up between lanes. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map

area.areaDesc: Central Coast Range of Western Oregon
